birth_place.zh-cn: 清朝河南省陈州府项城县袁张营
birth_place.en: Yuanzhangying, Xiangcheng, Chenzhou, Henan, Qing dynasty

description.zh-cn: 中国清末民初的军事家、政治家，北洋军的创始者与领导者，曾任中华民国临时大总统及正式大总统，后建立中华帝国但未能正式登基。
description.en: A Chinese military and government official during the late Qing dynasty and the early Republic of China. He was the founder and leader of the Beiyang Army, served as the Provisional and Formal President of the Republic of China, and later attempted to establish the Empire of China, although he was never formally enthroned.

description.zh-cn: 由袁世凯筹备建立的君主立宪制国家，计划取代中华民国，年号洪宪。在护国运动的压力下被迫取消。
description.en: A constitutional monarchy planned by Yuan Shikai to replace the Republic of China, with the era name Hongxian. It was abolished under the pressure of the National Protection War.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国建国初期，由北洋军阀所主导建立的中央政府，始于1912年袁世凯就任临时大总统。
description.en: The central government of the Republic of China in its early years, dominated by the Beiyang warlords, beginning with Yuan Shikai's inauguration as Provisional President in 1912.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上最后一个帝制王朝。
description.en: The last imperial dynasty of China.

description.zh-cn: 清朝最后一位皇帝。
description.en: The last emperor of the Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家，中华民国国父，首任临时大总统。
description.en: A Chinese revolutionary, statesman, and founding father of the Republic of China. He served as the first provisional president.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国第一任副总统，后两度担任大总统。
description.en: The first Vice President of the Republic of China, who later served as President twice.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家，皖系军阀首领，曾三次出任国务总理。
description.en: A politician and warlord of the Republic of China, leader of the Anhui clique, who served three times as Premier.

description.zh-cn: 推翻清朝、建立中华民国的革命。
description.en: The revolution that overthrew the Qing dynasty and established the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 1913年孙中山及国民党发动的旨在反对袁世凯的军事行动。
description.en: A military campaign launched by Sun Yat-sen and the Kuomintang in 1913 against Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 反对袁世凯称帝而发动的内战。
description.en: A civil war waged against Yuan Shikai's attempt to restore the monarchy.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国初年军事家，护国运动的主要组织者和领导者。
description.en: A Chinese revolutionary leader and warlord in the early Republic of China, a key organizer and leader of the National Protection War.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代革命家，国民党的主要筹建人，1913年被暗杀。
description.en: A Chinese revolutionary and a key founder of the Kuomintang, assassinated in 1913.

description.zh-cn: 日本帝国向中华民国袁世凯政府提出的一系列要求，旨在扩大其在华利益。
description.en: A set of demands made by the Empire of Japan to the government of the Republic of China under Yuan Shikai, aimed at expanding its interests in China.

description.zh-cn: 1868年至1947年间日本的国号。
description.en: The official name of Japan from 1868 to 1947.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国北洋政府与大日本帝国基于“二十一条”部分条款签订的条约。
description.en: Treaties signed between the Beiyang government of the Republic of China and the Empire of Japan, based on parts of the Twenty-One Demands.

description.zh-cn: 清朝宗室，宣统帝溥仪之父，曾任监国摄政王。
description.en: A prince of the Qing dynasty, father of Puyi, the Xuantong Emperor, and served as Prince-Regent.

description.zh-cn: 清末由袁世凯在小站编练的现代化军队，为北洋军的前身。
description.en: A modernised army trained by Yuan Shikai at Xiaozhan in the late Qing dynasty, the predecessor of the Beiyang Army.

description.zh-cn: 清末民初的一支重要军事政治力量，由袁世凯创建和领导。
description.en: An important military and political force in the late Qing dynasty and early Republic of China, founded and led by Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 晚清时期由光绪帝和维新派人士推动的一场政治改革运动，最终被慈禧太后发动的政变所中断。
description.en: A political reform movement in the late Qing dynasty initiated by the Guangxu Emperor and his reform-minded supporters, which was ended by a coup led by Empress Dowager Cixi.

description.zh-cn: 晚清政治家和军事家，慈禧太后的亲信。
description.en: A statesman and military leader in the late Qing dynasty, a confidant of Empress Dowager Cixi.

description.zh-cn: 晚清维新派政治家，戊戌六君子之一。
description.en: A reformist politician in the late Qing dynasty, one of the 'Six Gentlemen of the Wuxu Reform'.

description.zh-cn: 清朝第十一位皇帝，在位期间推动了戊戌变法。
description.en: The eleventh emperor of the Qing dynasty, who initiated the Hundred Days' Reform.

description.zh-cn: 1884年朝鲜开化党人发动的旨在推翻事大党政权的政变，被袁世凯率领的清军平定。
description.en: A coup d'état in 1884 by Korean pro-Japanese reformers aimed at overthrowing the pro-Qing government, which was suppressed by Qing troops led by Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪末中国北方的一场反对外国侵略和基督教传播的民间运动。
description.en: An anti-foreign, anti-Christian uprising in Northern China at the end of the 19th century.

description.zh-cn: 由杨度等人发起，旨在为袁世凯称帝制造舆论和理论支持的政治团体。
description.en: A political group initiated by Yang Du and others, aimed at creating public opinion and theoretical support for Yuan Shikai's enthronement.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代政治活动家，筹安会发起人，曾积极推动袁世凯称帝。
description.en: A Chinese politician active in the late Qing and early Republican periods, founder of the Chou'anhui, who actively promoted Yuan Shikai's monarchical ambitions.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯的原配妻子。
description.en: Yuan Shikai's first and primary wife.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯的长子，曾积极推动其父称帝。
description.en: Yuan Shikai's eldest son, who actively encouraged his father to become emperor.

description.zh-cn: 清末淮军将领，袁世凯早期的提携者。
description.en: A Huai Army general in the late Qing dynasty and an early patron of Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 光绪帝的皇后，宣统帝的皇额娘，颁布《宣统帝退位诏书》者。
description.en: Empress consort of the Guangxu Emperor and Empress Dowager for the Xuantong Emperor, who issued the imperial edict of abdication.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯在天津小站开始编练新建陆军，这支军队后来成为北洋军阀的前身。
description.en: Yuan Shikai began training the New Army at Xiaozhan, Tianjin, which later became the predecessor of the Beiyang warlords.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯将维新派的勤王计划告知荣禄，导致慈禧太后发动政变，囚禁光绪帝，变法失败。
description.en: Yuan Shikai informed Ronglu of the reformers' plan to protect the emperor, leading to a coup by Empress Dowager Cixi, the imprisonment of the Guangxu Emperor, and the failure of the reform.

description.zh-cn: 在担任山东巡抚期间，袁世凯采取强硬措施镇压义和团运动，维持了山东省的稳定。
description.en: As governor of Shandong, Yuan Shikai took strong measures to suppress the Boxer Rebellion, maintaining stability in the province.

description.zh-cn: 摄政王载沣以“回籍养疴”为名，罢免了袁世凯的官职。
description.en: Prince-Regent Zaifeng dismissed Yuan Shikai from his posts under the pretext of 'returning home to recuperate'.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯通过其手下段祺瑞等北洋将领通电威胁，迫使隆裕太后代表宣统皇帝颁布退位诏书，结束了清朝的统治。
description.en: Through his subordinate Duan Qirui and other Beiyang generals, Yuan Shikai threatened the court, forcing Empress Dowager Longyu to issue the abdication edict on behalf of the Xuantong Emperor, ending the Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 孙文辞去临时大总统一职，让位于袁世凯，以换取清帝退位和国家统一。
description.en: Sun Yat-sen resigned as provisional president in favor of Yuan Shikai in exchange for the Qing emperor's abdication and national unification.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯在北京就任中华民国临时大总统，建立了北洋政府，开启了北洋军阀统治时期。
description.en: Yuan Shikai took office as the Provisional President of the Republic of China in Beijing, establishing the Beiyang government and initiating the Beiyang warlord era.

description.zh-cn: 时人普遍认为袁世凯授意或幕后策划了对国民党领袖宋教仁的暗杀，以阻止其组阁。
description.en: It was widely believed at the time that Yuan Shikai ordered or masterminded the assassination of Kuomintang leader Song Jiaoren to prevent him from forming a cabinet.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯动用北洋军武力镇压了由国民党发动的“二次革命”。
description.en: Yuan Shikai used the Beiyang Army to militarily suppress the 'Second Revolution' launched by the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 日本帝国向袁世凯政府秘密提出旨在将中国纳入其保护国的“二十一条”要求。
description.en: The Empire of Japan secretly presented the 'Twenty-One Demands' to Yuan Shikai's government, aiming to turn China into a Japanese protectorate.

description.zh-cn: 在与日本进行了105天的谈判并收到最后通牒后，袁世凯政府被迫接受了“二十一条”的部分条款，签署了《中日民四条约》。
description.en: After 105 days of negotiations with Japan and receiving an ultimatum, Yuan Shikai's government was forced to accept parts of the 'Twenty-One Demands' and signed the 'Sino-Japanese Treaties of 1915'.

description.zh-cn: 杨度等人成立筹安会，为袁世凯称帝制造理论和舆论支持。
description.en: Yang Du and others established the Chou'anhui to create theoretical and public support for Yuan Shikai's accession to the throne.

description.zh-cn: 筹安会通过发表文章、组织请愿等方式，积极推动袁世凯恢复帝制。
description.en: The Chou'anhui actively promoted Yuan Shikai's restoration of the monarchy by publishing articles and organizing petitions.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯接受“国民代表大会”的推戴，宣布建立中华帝国，改元洪宪。
description.en: Yuan Shikai accepted the 'endorsement' of the National Representatives' Convention and announced the establishment of the Empire of China with the era name Hongxian.

description.zh-cn: 蔡锷与唐继尧等人在云南宣布独立，发动护国运动，武力讨伐袁世凯。
description.en: Cai E, Tang Jiyao, and others declared independence in Yunnan, launching the National Protection War to militarily oppose Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 在护国运动的军事和政治压力下，袁世凯被迫于1916年3月22日宣布取消帝制。
description.en: Under military and political pressure from the National Protection War, Yuan Shikai was forced to announce the cancellation of the monarchy on March 22, 1916.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯指挥清军击退日军，平定了朝鲜开化党人发动的甲申政变。
description.en: Yuan Shikai commanded Qing troops to repel Japanese forces, suppressing the Gapsin Coup launched by Korean reformists.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯于1876年底与于氏结婚，于氏是其原配妻子。
description.en: Yuan Shikai married Lady Yu at the end of 1876; she was his first and primary wife.

description.zh-cn: 袁克定是袁世凯与原配于氏所生的嫡长子。
description.en: Yuan Keding was the eldest legitimate son of Yuan Shikai and his primary wife, Lady Yu.

description.zh-cn: 1881年，袁世凯弃文就武，投靠淮军将领吴长庆，任“庆军”营务处会办。
description.en: In 1881, Yuan Shikai abandoned his civil pursuits for a military career, joining the command of Huai Army general Wu Changqing and serving as a staff officer.

description.zh-cn: 在戊戌变法期间，康有为派谭嗣同秘密游说手握重兵的袁世凯，希望他发动兵变支持光绪帝。
description.en: During the Hundred Days' Reform, Kang Youwei sent Tan Sitong to secretly lobby Yuan Shikai, who controlled a powerful army, hoping he would launch a coup to support the Guangxu Emperor.
